query.comment: Checks whethere there are any deadlocks in the system (also used for property 1)

Property 1 (liveness): Is it possible to get to our target location and then become idle again? We are skipping the state where we have to wait for the door, that state will be deadlocked in its own right. The idle transition will be deadlocked because time does not pass and queries are passed on from other automata.
If one lift has a deadlock, the others do too.

Property 1 (liveness): Is it possible to receive a destination and then become idle again? This is a single transition, but it needs to be added to check whether a lift control has a deadlock. The idle transition will be deadlocked because time does not pass and queries are passed on from other automata.
If one lift has a deadlock, the others do too.

query.formula: A[] not ((engine(0).moving_down or engine(0).moving_up) and (cabin_door(0).open or cabin_door(0).executing))
query.comment: Property 2(safety): There should not be any situation (~EG(~f)) where the lift doors should be oopen whilst changing floors (check for all lifts, in case we accidentally send information to wrong lift). As long as the cabin_door is closed, the protecting doors are closed as well. It would also be problematic if the doors are in the executing state (opening or closing).

query.formula: A[] not ((engine(1).moving_down or engine(1).moving_up) and (cabin_door(1).open or cabin_door(1).executing))
E<> is_full(0) and DGC(0).ready_to_go and current_floors[0] == get_peak_service_floor(0) and not current_floors[0] != get_peak_service_floor(0)
query.comment:
Property 3 (reachability): Elevators must be able to fill up their queue whilst being on the ground floor. The peak service floor is (initially) always set to 0, and the state where the FIFO (DGC) must be at is ready_to_go (ready for transit) and the queue of said lift must be full. There must be at least one state that exists for this exact state with these variables, and they should exist for every elevator. The query has to be split for the different elevators, because it would be a very slim chance that both lifts are in the exact same position every time.
The check to see whether it does not fill up on other floors is added to ensure that the queue never fills up above the peak service floor (ground floor).

Property 4 (Each floor above the ground floor can be reached, and only by the correct elevator.):

query.formula: DGC(0).emptying_queue --> DGC(0).empty_queue and is_empty(0) and lift_control(0).dest_floor == current_floors[0]
query.comment: Property 5 (liveness, all floor requests are eventually served, i.e., the elevator reaches its destination.): The lift must be able to travel from emptying_queue to idle in the FIFO and have an empty queue in that state, whilst reaching the destination floor.
